intro: Thymophylla pentachaeta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thymophylla, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Thymophylla pentachaeta is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
